instruction: How do I set the start frequency on the tinySA?
input: I need to set it to 300 MHz.
response: To set the start frequency on the tinySA, go to the frequency menu and select 'Start'. Enter the desired frequency using the keypad. For example, to set it to 300 MHz, type 300MHz.

instruction: How do I set the stop frequency on the tinySA?
input: Set it to 900 MHz.
response: To set the stop frequency on the tinySA, navigate to the frequency menu and select 'Stop'. Then enter the frequency value, such as 900 MHz, by typing 900M.

instruction: How do I set the frequency range for scanning on the tinySA?
input: I want to scan between 100 MHz and 400 MHz.
response: To set the frequency range for scanning, go to the frequency menu, set the start frequency to 100 MHz, and the stop frequency to 400 MHz.

instruction: How can I save the spectrum data to a file on tinySA?
input: I have inserted a USB drive.
response: To save spectrum data to a file on the tinySA, insert a USB flash drive, press 'Save', and choose 'Save Trace' or 'Save Screenshot'. The file will be saved to the USB device.

instruction: Can I use the tinySA to scan between 300 MHz and 900 MHz?
input: I want to set the frequency range to 300 MHz to 900 MHz.
response: Yes, you can scan between 300 MHz and 900 MHz by setting the start frequency to 300M and stop frequency to 900M in the frequency menu.

instruction: How do I verify the frequency range is correctly set on tinySA?
input: Check the display after setting the frequencies.
response: You can verify the frequency range by checking the top-left and top-right values of the display, which show the start and stop frequencies respectively.

instruction: How can I export data from tinySA for later analysis?
input: Save the trace to the USB drive.
response: You can export data by saving the trace to a USB flash drive. After saving, you can open the file on a computer for further analysis using spreadsheet or plotting software.

instruction: How can I check the center frequency of my spectrum?
input: I want to measure the center frequency between 100 MHz and 400 MHz.
response: The center frequency is the midpoint between the start and stop frequencies. For a 100 MHz to 400 MHz range, the center frequency is 250 MHz.

instruction: How do I set the reference level on the tinySA?
input: Adjust the reference level to -20 dBm.
response: To set the reference level, go to the 'Level' menu and select 'Reference Level'. Adjust it to -20 dBm.

instruction: How do I calibrate the tinySA?
input: I want to calibrate the device before use.
response: To calibrate the tinySA, go to the 'Calibrate' menu and select 'Start Calibration'. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the calibration process.

instruction: How can I check the signal strength of a particular frequency?
input: Check the signal strength at 500 MHz.
response: To check the signal strength, set the frequency to 500 MHz in the frequency menu and check the signal level displayed on the screen.

instruction: Can I display the spectrum in log scale?
input: Switch the display to log scale.
response: Yes, you can switch the display to log scale. Go to the 'Display' menu and select 'Log Scale'.

instruction: How do I adjust the resolution bandwidth?
input: Set the resolution bandwidth to 10 kHz.
response: To adjust the resolution bandwidth, go to the 'RBW' menu and select 10 kHz.

instruction: How do I set the trigger mode on the tinySA?
input: Set the trigger mode to auto.
response: To set the trigger mode, go to the 'Trigger' menu and select 'Auto'.

instruction: How do I add a marker on the spectrum display?
input: Place a marker at 500 MHz.
response: To add a marker, press the 'Marker' button and use the arrow keys to place the marker at 500 MHz.

instruction: How do I change the timebase on the tinySA?
input: Set the timebase to 1 ms.
response: To change the timebase, go to the 'Timebase' menu and select 1 ms.

instruction: How do I turn on the backlight of the display?
input: Increase the display brightness.
response: To adjust the backlight, go to the 'Display' menu and select 'Backlight'. Increase the brightness to your preference.

instruction: How do I reset the tinySA to factory settings?
input: I want to reset everything to default.
response: To reset to factory settings, go to the 'System' menu and select 'Reset to Factory Defaults'.

instruction: How do I perform a spectrum scan between 500 MHz and 1 GHz?
input: Start a scan in the range of 500 MHz to 1 GHz.
response: To scan between 500 MHz and 1 GHz, set the start frequency to 500 MHz and the stop frequency to 1 GHz in the frequency menu. Then press 'Start Scan'.

instruction: How do I measure the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR)?
input: I want to measure the SNR for the signal at 700 MHz.
response: To measure the SNR, set the frequency to 700 MHz and use the 'SNR' function in the analysis menu.

instruction: How do I use the tinySA to perform a sweep?
input: I want to perform a frequency sweep from 100 MHz to 500 MHz.
response: To perform a sweep, set the start frequency to 100 MHz and the stop frequency to 500 MHz. Then press 'Start Sweep' from the 'Sweep' menu.

instruction: How do I change the display mode on the tinySA?
input: Switch to the waterfall display mode.
response: To change the display mode, go to the 'Display' menu and select 'Waterfall'.

instruction: How do I turn on the tracking generator?
input: Enable the tracking generator.
response: To enable the tracking generator, go to the 'Generator' menu and select 'Enable Tracking Generator'.
